content.question: Beta-carotene is an organic compound with an orange color. The diagram above shows the ultraviolet spectrum of beta-carotene. Which of the following statements is true about the absorption bands in the spectrum?

choices.label: The absorption band between <math alttext="250" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>250</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="320 nanometers" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>320</mn><mtext> </mtext><mo>⁢</mo><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mo>⁢</mo><mi>n</mi><mi>m</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is due to transitions in electronic energy levels, and the absorption band between <math alttext="380" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>380</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="520 nanometers" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>520</mn><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext> </mtext><mi>n</mi><mi>m</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is due to transitions in molecular vibrational levels.

The absorption band between <math alttext="250" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>250</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="320 nanometers" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>320</mn><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext> </mtext><mi>n</mi><mi>m</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is due to transitions in molecular vibrational levels, and the absorption band between <math alttext="380" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>380</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="520 nanometers" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>520</mn><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext> </mtext><mi>n</mi><mi>m</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is due to transitions in molecular rotational levels.

The two main absorption bands are associated with transitions in electronic energy levels. The band in the region corresponding to shorter wavelengths shows a lower absorbance than the band in the region corresponding to longer wavelengths.

The two main absorption bands are associated with transitions in molecular vibrational levels. The band in the region corresponding to shorter wavelengths shows a lower absorbance than the band in the region corresponding to longer wavelengths.

content.answer: The two main absorption bands are associated with transitions in electronic energy levels. The band in the region corresponding to shorter wavelengths shows a lower absorbance than the band in the region corresponding to longer wavelengths.

skill.text: 4.A: Predict and/or explain chemical properties or phenomena (e.g., of atoms or molecules) using given chemical theories, models, and representations.
